Posts.Content: LauraAsh2009 wrote: After showering this morning, I looked in the mirror and noticed that the area above my left aerola looked red and swollen. It almost looked like the aerola itself had spread upward. It's probably swollen in a circle about 3/4 of an inch. Also, it seemed like my left nipple was a little bit darker than the right one. I felt around the area, and thought I could feel a bump, but when I checked a second time, I felt nothing. I am scared to death, because I have been googling the symptoms and the first hit I always get is inflammatory breast cancer. I am only 21 years old, I know that it is still possible, but I really hope that is not it!Â  I've always been kind of a worrier though, so I am absolutely freaking out about this. I have a an appointment with my University Health Center tomorrow, but I am afraid I am going to be skeptical of any answers they give me as University Health Centers have bad reputations. I don't know who else to go to. I don't have any health insurance or a primary doctor. Should I go to the emergency room? I want to stay on top of this, as I realize early detection is absolutely vital. But without health insurance, this is going to be hard! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: So Worried LauraAsh2009 Rhiness
